text: I have mod_fcgid 2.2 (RPM installed from EPEL) and httpd 2.2.4 running on CentOS 5.2. mod_fcgid is used to serve PHP scripts. In one of the folder I have a Header directive in .htaccess to add a P3P header response. However, when mod_fcgid is used to serve PHP, the Header directive seems to be ignored and would have no effect. Is this a limitation of mod_fcgid? A bug? My own misconfiguration?
creator: jack@jackchung.com
nick@webthing.com
text:
It's looks like your configuration, or possibly confused expectations.

Please use a support forum such as the users mailinglist at httpd.apache.org to figure it out, and re-open if it turns out there really is a bug after that.
